sn56.58:1.1: “Mendicants, suppose the water in the ocean dried up and evaporated except for two or three drops.
sn56.58:1.3: Which is more: the water in the ocean that has dried up and evaporated, or the two or three drops left?”
sn56.58:1.4: “Sir, the water in the ocean that has dried up and evaporated is certainly more. The two or three drops left are tiny.
sn56.58:1.5: Compared to the water in the ocean that has dried up and evaporated, it can’t be reckoned or compared, it’s not even a fraction.”
sn56.58:1.6: “In the same way, for a noble disciple …
sn56.58:1.7: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
